content.description: Central Perk, Frank and Alice are there talking with Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! I can’t believe my little brother is married!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Oh I know!! (Both he and Alice squeal hysterically)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys, why didn’t you tell me you were eloping?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: ‘Cause it just sorta happened, y’know we were at the courthouse, we were having lunch…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait, wait, why were you at the courthouse?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: We were having lunch. Yeah and then all of the sudden we were like, “Hey! Y’know, we’re here, having lunch let’s get married!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow, a year and a half ago I didn’t even know I had a brother, and now I have a sister too. (They all hug, and Frank and Alice start kissing.) Okay. Okay. Stop it, don’t. So, I gotta get you a gift now. Is there anything you need?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Uhh, yeah.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: We’ve been trying to get pregnant, uh pretty much ever since we got engaged, we thought we’d get a jump on things, y’know no one’s getting any younger.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: See the thing is umm, we’re not able to y’know, uh, conceive.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: And we’ve tried everything, we’ve seen a bunch of doctors.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah, and they-and they say that our-that our only chance to have a baby is that if they take my sperm, her egg and put it together in a dish and then put it into another girl. So we were wondering if you could be the girl that we could put it into.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s a really nice gift. I was thinking of like a gravy boat.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica, Rachel, and Chandler are trying to throw cards into a vase.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! You guys! Check it out, check it out! (He’s wearing a blue blazer) Guess which job I got.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know, but Donald Trump wants his blue blazer black.
(The gang is stunned.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Blue blazer back. He-he wants it back.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But you-you said black. Why would he want his blue blazer black?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you-you know what I meant.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, you messed it up. You’re stupid.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So what job did you get Joe?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, ah, tour guide at the museum. Yeah, Ross got it for me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, how can you be a tour guide, don’t you have to be a dinosaur expert or something?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, not really. They give you all the information, it’s uh, it’s like memorizing a script. (Making like a tour guide) “And on your left, you have Tyrannosaurus Rex, a carnivore from the Jurassic period.

content.speaker: Chandler, Monica, and Rachel
content.text: Great!! That’s great!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh actually Joey, it’s the Cretasous period.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah but, I can pronounce Jurassic.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Guess what. Frank Jr., and Alice got married!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh my God!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And! And, they’re gonna have a baby! (The gang is shocked.) And! And, they want me to grow it for them in my uterus. (The gang is stunned into silence.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you serious?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re really thinking about having sex with your brother?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ewww! And “Oh no!” It’s—they just want me to be the surrogate. It’s her-it’s her egg and her sperm, and I’m-I’m just the oven, it’s totally their bun.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What did you tell them?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, they said that I had to think about it first, but what is there to think about? I’m gonna be giving them the greatest gift you can possibly give.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re gonna be carrying their baby and give them a Sony Play Station ?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, this really is an incredible thing to do for them, but there are things to think about.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, like you’re gonna be pregnant. I mean pregnant.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pheebs, you’re talking about putting your body through an awful lot, I mean morning sickness, uhh, labour, and it’s all for somebody else!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, what’s your point?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, the stuff I just mentioned.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! I don’t know if I could ever do that. I always figured the first time I had a baby was with somebody I love and that baby would be a…keeper.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know you guys were a lot more supportive when I wanted to make denim furniture.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, Pheebs, listen, if you decide to do this, we’ll be supportive like crazy.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We just want you to think it through.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, honey, maybe you can talk to somebody who’s had a baby. Like your mom?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: My mom never gave birth. Oh! But my birth mom did.

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler and Kathy are kissing.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Umm, (moves her hand’s down to his butt) I love this touchy. Can I take it to work with me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, yeah, sure, it’s not mine anyway. It can with the pants.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Oh! (They kiss and she leaves)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I am so jealous.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You guys are really right…there aren’t you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes. Right where?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: In the beginning where y’know it’s all sex and talking and sex and talking and…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, you-you gotta love the talking.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And the sex?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, we haven’t had sex yet. Okay, what’s the big deal? Y’know? This is special, and I want our love to grow until we move on to the next level.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Chandler that is so nice.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That is really nice…lying! No way is that the reason!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why? Just because you’re not mature enough to understand something like that?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, he’s right, I’m totally lying.
(Ross makes an “I was right, and you weren’t face.” And Rachel does Ross’s little I’m-flicking-you-off-but-I’m-not-giving-you-the-finger banging of the fists.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Then what is it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, Kathy’s last boyfriend was Joey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And you’re afraid you won’t be able to…fill his shoes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I’m afraid I won’t be able to make love as well as him.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I was going for the metaphor.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, and I was saying the actual words.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So big deal, so Joey’s had a lot of girlfriends, it doesn’t mean he’s great in bed.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We share a wall! So either he’s great in bed, or she just likes to agree with him a lot.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sweetie, with you it’s gonna be different. The sex is gonna be great, ‘cause you-you guys are in love.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just go for it Chandler.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, you should.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, you should, really.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Go on.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, all right, I’ll go sleep with my girlfriend. But I’m just doing it for you guys.

content.description: The museum, Joey is giving a tour to a bunch of school kids.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, now the Mastodon is from the semi-late Jurassic period.

content.speaker: Smart Kid
content.text: Isn’t the Mastodon from the Pliocene Epic?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Shhh! This is a museum, no talking. Right down here, (Motions to a fossilised dinosaur foot.) we have a large foot. (Sees Ross working in one of the display cases.) Uhh, and over here we have Ross Geller. (Knocks on the glass) Everyone wave ‘Hi’ to Ross. Ross is one of our most important scientists, look at him, hard at work. (Ross does the old “Putting a cigarette in your ear and pulling it out of your mouth trick.”) Okay, moving right along. Come on.

content.description: Phoebe Sr.’s house, there’s a knock on the door.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: It’s open! Come in!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m sorry, I’m late.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: Oh, that’s okay, it gave me time to finish glazing my nipples.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! You really go all out when you’re expecting company.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: No, I was working on my pottery.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! Ooh! Oh, I didn’t know that you did…pot.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: Well, yeah, mostly nudes. It combines my two passions, pottery and erotica.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, erotiery!

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: Hey! Okay! Well thanks for coming out to see me. I just-I just thought it would be a very good idea to talk about this baby stuff in person. Y’know…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: I really don’t think it’s a very good idea, Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: Well, because you’d be giving up a baby, and I-I really don’t—I don’t know if there’s anything I can say that could make you understand the pain of giving up a baby. So, umm, (Picks up a puppy in the box next to the couch.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no! No-no! I understand the pain! Don’t-don’t hurt the puppy.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: No-no-no, the-the puppy’s yours.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I get a puppy!!

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: Well, yeah! I mean yeah, but only for three days.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: I realise I don’t have any right to start get all parenty on you and everything now, but umm, (Sees that Phoebe isn’t paying attention and is busy mimicking the puppy.) uhh… Phoebe, would you please look at me and not the puppy, it’s very important.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: I mean, I know what I’m talking about. I gave up two babies, and I only wish I had someone there that had given up babies, that could tell me how terrible it is to give up babies. I just think that, it would be something you will regret every single day for the rest of your life. So, how ever hard it is to give up this puppy, it would be like a million times harder to give up a child. (Phoebe is playing with the puppy again, and not listening) I really shouldn’t have given you the puppy first.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, I’m sorry.

content.description: The museum’s worker cafeteria, Joey is eating lunch with the rest of the tour guides. Another tour guide tries to sit down in a seat Joey saved for Ross.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, do you mind sitting there. I’m-I’m saving this for my friend Ross.

content.speaker: Tour Guide
content.text: You mean Dr. Geller?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Doctor? Wow! I didn’t know he had a nickname.

content.speaker: Tour Guide
content.text: Oh, he won’t sit here. Only the people in the white coats sit over there, (Points to there table) and only the people in the blue blazers sit here.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, how-how come?

content.speaker: Tour Guide
content.text: That’s just the way it is.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s crazy.

content.speaker: Tour Guide
content.text: Maybe it’s crazy in a perfect world, a world without lab coats and blazers, but you not in a perfect world, you in a museum now. See that scientist in the classes, he and I used to play together all the time in grade school, but now…(Turns around) Peter! Hey, Peter! It’s me Rhonda! From PS-129! I shared my puddin’ which you man! I gave you my Snack Pack ! (to Joey) See, he pretend he don’t even here me!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I-I think everybody’s pretending they don’t hear you. Anyway, look, I don’t know about you and your jackets and your separate tables, but Ross is one of my best friends, and if I save him a seat, I’m telling you, he will sit in it! (Ross enters and goes over to the white table) Ross! Ross! Over here, man! I-I saved you seat.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s okay, I’m cool over here. I’ll catch up with you later, Joey. (Joey is shocked.)
(Another woman enters without a coat or blazer and tries to sit at the ‘blue’ table.)

content.speaker: Tour Guide
content.text: Op, this is saved. (Joey wonders why) Gift shop.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey is eating dinner, Monica and Rachel are sitting on the couch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, uh, I’m really, really sorry about what happened in the cafeteria today.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s no big deal. Hey, y’know, you do what you gotta do. Right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But hey, it’s not just me, I mean the scientists and the tour guides never sit together.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whatever.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s like that everywhere, Joey! Okay, Mon, back me up here. Where you work the uh, waiters eat with the waiters, right? And the chefs eat with the other chefs, right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I eat by myself in the alley because everybody hates me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, Ross, really it’s-it’s no big deal. Y’know you wear a white coat, I wear a blue blazer, if that means we can’t be friends at work, then so be it. Y’know, hey I understand. Y’know? Hey, when I’m in a play and you’re in the audience, I don’t talk to you, right? So it’s y’know, it’s uh, it’s cool. I’ll see you tomorrow. (Leaves)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, when we’re in the audience he doesn’t talk to us, but he does wave.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the next morning, Phoebe is there with her puppy and is trying to sing it to sleep as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why is Phoebe singing to Carl Mulden?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, y’know what, I think it’s time for puppy to go out again. Come on, let’s go to the balcony.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, the street. Come on, let’s go to the street. Ooh, listen, don’t go onto the balcony until after I get back. (Leaves)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, did you do it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, yes, we had the sex.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh-oh, it was bad?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It was fine, y’know? But she didn’t agree with me as strongly as she agreed with Joey. She was more like, “I see you point, I’m all right with it.”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, it was the first time. Y’know, there’s not always a lot of agreement the first time.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, not girls anyway, guys agree (snaps her fingers) like that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, you have to help me! Okay? I mean, I know what to do with a woman, y’know, I know where everything goes, it’s always nice. But I need to know what makes it go from nice to, “My God! Somebody’s killing her in there!”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, I’m gonna show you something a lot of guys don’t know. Rach, give me that pad, please? (She does so and Monica starts drawing on it) All right. Now…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, you don’t have to draw an actual wo—whoa! She’s hot!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Now everybody knows the basic erogenous zones. (She starts labelling them) You got one, two three, four (Chandler is shocked to find out there’s more than three), five, six, and seven!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There are seven?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Let me see that. (Monica shows her) Oh, yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s one?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s kind of an important one!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, y’know-y’know what, I was looking at it upside down.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, y’know, sometimes that helps. (She realises what that could’ve meant.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Now, most guys will hit uh, 1-2-3 and then go to 7 and set up camp.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That-that’s bad?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well if you go to Disneyland , you don’t spend the whole day on the Materhorn.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well you might if it were anything like 7!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right uh, the important thing is to take your time, you want to hit ‘em all, and you mix ‘em up. You gotta keep them on their toes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oo, toes!! Well, for some people. (Chandler eyes her and her toes.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right. Umm, you could uh start out with a little 1, a 2, a 1-2-3, 3, 5, a 4, a 3-2, 2, a 2-4-6, 2-4-6, 4, (Rachel starts getting worked up) 2, 2, 4-7, 5-7, 6-7, 7, …7…7…7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7…(mouths 7)! (They both lean back on the couch satisfied.)

content.description: The museum cafeteria, Joey is eating with the tour guides as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Older Scientist
content.text: Dr. Geller, there’s a seat over here. (Motions to an empty chair at the ‘white’ table.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you, Dr. Phillips, but I’m having my lunch at this table, here in the middle. I’m having lunch right here, with my good friend Joey, if he’ll sit with me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I will sit with you Dr. Geller. (He goes over to his table and they shake hands.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know, we work in a museum of natural history, and yet there is something unnatural about the way we eat lunch. Now, I look around this cafeteria, and y’know what I see, I see-I see division. Division, between people in white coats and people in blue blazers, and I ask myself, “My God why?!” Now, I say we shed these-these coats that separate us, and we get to know the people underneath. (He takes off his coat and throws it down.) I’m Ross! I’m divorced, and I have a kid!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m Joey! I’m an actor! I don’t know squat about dinosaurs!
content.parenthetical: stands up, and throws his coat on the floor

content.speaker: Another Tour Guide
content.text: I’m Ted, and I just moved here a month ago, and New York really scares me.
content.parenthetical: standing up and removing his coat

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, there you go!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, you hang in there Teddy!

content.speaker: Older Scientist
content.text: I’m Andrew, and I didn’t pay for this pear.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, good-good for you.

content.speaker: Tour Guide
content.text: I’m Rhonda, (motions to her breasts) and these aren’t real! (Joey and Ross look at each other, shocked)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow, Rhonda.

content.speaker: Another Scientist
content.text: I’m Scott.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, okay, Scott!

content.speaker: Another Scientist
content.text: And I need to flip the light switch on and off 17 times before I leave a room or my family will die.

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe, with the puppy, Monica, and Rachel are sitting on the couch.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: My mom’s gonna be here any minute. I can’t do this, I can’t give him up. Yes—no, I can. I don’t want to. But I can. No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oo, I can’t watch this, it’s like Sophie’s Choice .

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know, I never saw that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, it was only okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, I can’t do this. My mom was right. If I can’t-if I can’t give him up, then there’s no way I can give up a baby. Ohh, God, Frank and Alice are gonna be so crushed. What-what else, what else can I give ‘em—a kidney!

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Uhh, we were just in the neighbourhood, so…

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah, so we just thought we’d stop by and let you know there’s still no pressure.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: None. But if there was something you wanted to tell us, we’re just gonna be right over there (points to the counter) having coffee.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Oh, who’s this little guy?! (Grabs the puppy)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! Ooh! Umm!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Oh, he’s so cute, he reminds me of my old dog, Tumour.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: You are so precious, I could just take you home.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, why don’t you?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Are you serious?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh, yeah!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Oh, thanks.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I’m really okay with this. Y’know why? ‘Cause look at them, and I made that, so… I know it’s gonna be like a million times harder to give up a baby but, oh my God, it’s gonna feel like a million times better, right? I wanna do this. (To Frank and Alice) I wanna carry your baby.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Oh! Oh! Oh! Thank you so much! You don’t know what this means to us! Oh!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Oh my God, I think I’m gonna cry!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s gonna be so great.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: Hi! What’s going on?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I-I gave them the puppy and it made them so happy that I decided I’m gonna carry their baby.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: But Phoebe…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No-no-no, I know, but you and I are different people though, and this is a totally different situation, and I know that I am not gonna regret this.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: Oh, I-I-I understand all that, but it’s just—that was my puppy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Rachel are sitting at the table.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Would you ever be a surrogate for anyone?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It depends on who asked.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What if I asked?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Mon, sure.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes. (Pause) You’re not asking are you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes! Totally!
(Kathy runs in, hair all out of place, and hugs Monica.)

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Oh! Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! Yes! Thank you! (Runs back to Chandler)
